search_input: . . . the floor. That’s right. The floor. It’s typically the largest horizontal surface in the room and undeniably the most used. It is the element that is in constant contact, can't escape gravity after all.
suggested_query: As we walk on it, our footsteps echo and the space is filled with the faint scent of worn-out polish. In the corners, the shadows cast by the furniture create a sense of depth and mystery, like hidden secrets waiting to be uncovered. The map-like pattern seems to shift and change as we move around it, its meaning remaining elusive but captivating nonetheless.
suggest_context: 4.1.1 FLOOR . . . staking the claim of civilization on the raw ground, encoding usage and assuming decoration, the floor then accrues complexity in its section while simplifying its surface details. The textural details of previous occupants are kept intact. There is a map-like pattern on the concrete floor. It is a space of pure white. . . . the floor. Thats right. The floor. Its typically the largest horizontal surface in the room and undeniably the most used. It is the element that is in constant contact, can't escape gravity after all.
